NewsIndiaIndia Weather Forecast Today LIVE Updates: Light rain, thunderstorms likely in Delhi; IMD issues red alert for Odisha, Jharkhand
India Weather Forecast Today LIVE Updates: Light rain, thunderstorms likely in Delhi; IMD issues red alert for Odisha, Jharkhand
Weather Forecast Forecast Today, Rain Alert LIVE Updates: Get the latest rain alerts and IMD weather forecast updates for Mumbai, Delhi-NCR (including Noida, Ghaziabad, and Gurgaon), Gujarat, Kutch, Kolkata, Kerala districts like Malappuram, Kozhikode, Wayanad, Kannur, Kasaragod, and more cities across India.
By: Express Web Desk Updated: June 18, 2025 10:59 IST
Konkan, Goa, and Madhya Maharashtra regions are also likely to witness isolated heavy to very heavy rainfall today. (Express Photo by Akash Patil)

India Weather Forecast Today LIVE Updates:¬†After a day of heavy rain, Delhi is likely to experience light showers and thunderstorms throughout the day on Wednesday, according to the India Meteorological Department. As per the forecast for today, a yellow alert has been issued in Delhi for light rain, thunderstorms and surface winds. Similar weather conditions will also prevail in nearby cities such as Ghaziabad, Gautam Buddha Nagar and Gurgaon. The minimum temperature in Delhi is expected to settle at 27 degrees Celsius, while the maximum temperature is likely to reach 33 degrees Celsius.

Red alert in Odisha, Jharkhand, North East: The weather department issued a red alert for Odisha, Jharkhand and parts of West Bengal for Wednesday, June 18. Heavy rainfall, thunderstorms and strong surface winds are expected in all three states, while an orange alert has been issued in Bihar. Further, a red alert was issued in Assam and orange alert has been issued in bordering states in Northeast India, warning of moderate to heavy rainfall and thunderstorms throughout the day today.

South India: The IMD has issued an ‚Äòorange‚Äô alert for Karnataka, indicating heavy to very heavy rainfall, along with thunderstorms, lightning and gusty winds, with speed reaching 40-50 kmph, across the state. Other parts of South India such as Tamil Nadu, Puducherry, Karaikal, Kerala, Mahe, Lakshadweep, coastal Andhra Pradesh, Yanam, Rayalaseema, and Telangana will also receive light to moderate rainfall today.

LIVE UPDATES
Sort
Latest
Oldest
10:59 (IST) 18 Jun 2025
India Weather Forecast Today LIVE Updates: Powai Lake overflows after heavy rainfall in Mumbai

Mumbai‚Äôs Powai Lake, an artificial reservoir managed by the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC), began overflowing on Wednesday morning following continuous heavy rainfall in its catchment area over the last two days.

The lake, which has a storage capacity of 545 crore litres (5.45 billion litres), started overflowing at around 6 AM, with water levels reaching 195.10 feet, the BMC said.

In a post on X, the BMC shared a video of the lake overflowing. It further stated, ‚ÄúPowai Lake, one of the main artificial lakes under the jurisdiction of the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC), began overflowing around 6 am today. With a storage capacity of 545 crore litres (5.45 billion litres), the lake‚Äôs water is non-potable and is primarily used for industrial purposes and non-potable uses in the Aarey Milk Colony. The lake has reached its capacity and started overflowing due to heavy rainfall in its catchment area over the past two days. As of now, the water level stands at 195.10 feet.‚Äù

   
10:23 (IST) 18 Jun 2025
India Weather Forecast Today LIVE Updates: Orange alert in Delhi today

Moderate to heavy rain accompanied by lightning and thunderstorms is predicted in the national capital on Wednesday night, the weather office said.

The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued an orange alert for rain in the city. The relative humidity at 8.30 am was 82 per cent.

   
09:49 (IST) 18 Jun 2025
India Weather Forecast Today LIVE Updates: Pre monsoon hits Rajasthan, heavy rainfall in Jaipur

Pre-monsoon seasonal activities in Rajasthan gained momentum on Tuesday when several districts including the capital city Jaipur received heavy rainfall, the meteorological department said.

The Met said that according to the current circulation system the southwest monsoon may hit the state in a day or two.

On Tuesday, Pilani received 53.1 mm of rain followed by 51.6 mm in Churu, 37.6 mm in Jaipur, 16 mm in Jalore, and 14 mm in Alwar. Rains also lashed many places in most districts including Dausa, Sirohi, Sikar and Jodhpur.

A low pressure area is formed over Gujarat and surrounding areas. It is likely to move towards southern Rajasthan during the next 24 hours, the weather department said. (PTI)

   
ADVERTISEMENT
09:17 (IST) 18 Jun 2025
India Weather Forecast Today LIVE Updates: Light rains likely in Delhi

For Wednesday, the IMD has issued a yellow alert, predicting thunderstorms with lightning, light to moderate rainfall, and thundersqualls with wind speeds of 50-60 kmph, particularly during the night.

The maximum and minimum temperatures are expected to hover around 34 and 27 degrees Celsius.

The IMD also issued a moderate thunderstorm warning, highlighting potential impacts and precautionary measures. It cautioned that intense lightning could pose a threat to life, especially in open areas.

   
20:27 (IST) 17 Jun 2025
India Weather Forecast Today LIVE Updates: Parts of Delhi waterlogged as rain slashes capital

Several areas of Delhi were waterlogged as rain slashed the capital on Tuesday. A total of fourteen complaints were received by the department, with the highest complaints coming from Karol Bagh zone from Sudarshan Park, Kirti Nagar, and Karam Pura.

   
19:13 (IST) 17 Jun 2025
India Weather Forecast Today LIVE Updates: Red alert issued for Assam, Meghalaya as extreme heavy rain expected over next two days

With the prediction of extreme heavy rainfall along with thunderstorms and lightning in Assam and Meghalaya over the next two days, the Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) issued a ‚Äòred alert‚Äô for the two states asking the respective state governments to ensure the safety of people, an official statement said on Tuesday.

The ‚Äòred alert‚Äô will be in force on Wednesday and Thursday while on Friday, an ‚Äòorange alert‚Äô has been issued for both the states. (PTI)

   
ADVERTISEMENT
18:04 (IST) 17 Jun 2025
India Weather Forecast Today LIVE Updates: Red alert issued for 3 districts in coastal Karnataka

Udupi, Dakshin Kannada and Kodagu in south of coastal Karnataka will receive extremely heavy rainfall with strong surface winds, according to the India Meteorological Department (IMD). The agency has issued red alerts for these two districts.

   
17:25 (IST) 17 Jun 2025
India Weather Forecast Today LIVE Updates: IMD issues red alert for four states

The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued red alerts for south Bengal, coastal Karnataka, Kerala and Gujarat. These regions will receive very heavy to extremely heavy rainfall for the next 24 hours.

   
16:33 (IST) 17 Jun 2025
India Weather Forecast Today LIVE Updates: Heavy rain to hit Delhi

The IMD has issued a red alert for Delhi. Moderate to heavy rainfall is likely to hit the national capital, accompanied by gusts reaching up to 80 kmph.

   
ADVERTISEMENT
14:41 (IST) 17 Jun 2025
India Weather Forecast Today LIVE Updates: Light to moderate rainfall likely in parts of Northeast India today

Parts of Northeast India will receive light to moderate rainfall, accompanied by thunderstorms, lightning, and gusty winds over the next 7 days, the IMD forecast stated.

Meghalaya, meanwhile, is set to receive extremely heavy rainfall on June 18 and 19, as per the forecast.

   
14:21 (IST) 17 Jun 2025
India Weather Forecast Today LIVE Updates: Heavy rain lashes parts of Jaipur, bringing much-needed relief from the heat.

Heavy rainfall lashed parts of Jaipur in Rajasthan, bringing much-needed relief from the heat, news agency PTI reported.

VIDEO | Jaipur, Rajasthan: Heavy rain lashes parts of the city, bringing much-needed relief from the heat.

(Full video available on PTI Videos ‚Äì https://t.co/n147TvrpG7) pic.twitter.com/eNXnJqcV5x

‚Äî Press Trust of India (@PTI_News) June 17, 2025

   
14:00 (IST) 17 Jun 2025
India Weather Forecast Today LIVE Updates: Parts of East and Central India to receive heavy to very heavy rainfall today

West Bengal, Sikkim, Bihar, Jharkhand, Odisha, Chhattisgarh, Vidarbha, and Gangetic West Bengal are likely to receive isolated heavy to very rainfall on Tuesday, the IMD forecast stated.

Light to moderate rainfall, accompanied by thunderstorms, lightning and gusty winds are also likely over Andaman and Nicobar Islands today.

A thundersquall, with wind speed reaching 50-60 kmph, gusting to 70 kmph, is also likely at isolated places over Madhya Pradesh, Jharkhand, Bihar today.

   
ADVERTISEMENT
13:56 (IST) 17 Jun 2025
India Weather Forecast Today LIVE Updates: Heavy rainfall likely in East Uttar Pradesh, Uttarakhand today, says IMD

The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has forecasted isolated heavy rainfall for East Uttar Pradesh and Uttarakhand on Tuesday.

Rajasthan will witness thundersquall, with wind speed reaching 50-60 kmph, gusting to 70 kmph, today.

   
13:45 (IST) 17 Jun 2025
India Weather Forecast Today LIVE Updates: 6 NDRF teams deployed as heavy rain lashes Saurashtra, Gadhada regions

Six National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) teams were deployed as heavy rain lashed Saurashtra and Gadhada regions, recording 14 inches of rainfall in the last 24 hours, news agency PTI reported.

VIDEO | Gandhinagar, Gujarat: 6 NDRF teams deployed as heavy rain lashes Saurashtra, Gadhada and records 14 inches of rainfall in 24 hours. pic.twitter.com/ioEskzVsre

‚Äî Press Trust of India (@PTI_News) June 17, 2025

   
12:08 (IST) 17 Jun 2025
India Weather Forecast Today LIVE Updates: Heavy rains continue in Kerala, Meenachil river overflows

Heavy monsoon showers continued in Kerala‚Äôs Kottayam, causing the Meenachil river to overflow early Tuesday, news agency PTI reported, sharing a video.

Several trees have been uprooted due to strong winds. Emergency teams are actively engaged in clearance and restoration operations across affected areas, PTI noted.

VIDEO | Kottayam, Kerala: Heavy monsoon rains continue, causing the Meenachil river to overflow. Several trees have been uprooted due to strong winds. Emergency teams are actively engaged in clearance and restoration operations across affected areas.keralarains

(Full video‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/NG2EZ5Pbss

‚Äî Press Trust of India (@PTI_News) June 17, 2025

   
ADVERTISEMENT
12:05 (IST) 17 Jun 2025
India Weather Forecast Today LIVE Updates: Rain lashes parts of Varanasi city today

Rain lashed parts of Varanasi city, bringing much-needed relief from scorching heat on Tuesday, news agency PTI reported.

VIDEO | Varanasi: Rain lashes parts of the city, brings much-needed relief from scorching heat.

(Full video available on PTI Videos ‚Äì https://t.co/n147TvrpG7) pic.twitter.com/lJ7HHTKB4Y

‚Äî Press Trust of India (@PTI_News) June 17, 2025

   
12:02 (IST) 17 Jun 2025
India Weather Forecast Today LIVE Updates: Pre-monsoon showers arrive in Himachal Pradesh

Pre-monsoon showers arrived in Himachal Pradesh on Tuesday, news agency PTI reported.

Rainfall is likely to continue across the state till June 22, even as the monsoon is expected to reach by June 25.

Shobhit Katiyar, a meteorologist at the Meteorological Centre in Shimla, told PTI, ‚ÄúThe pre-monsoon rainfall will continue in the state till June 22. Between June 20 and 22, some areas may experience heavy rainfall, for which a yellow alert has been issued. The southwest monsoon is likely to arrive in Himachal Pradesh around June 25.‚Äù

VIDEO | Shimla: Pre-monsoon showers arrive in Himachal Pradesh; rainfall likely to continue across the state till June 22, the monsoon expected to reach by June 25.
Shobhit Katiyar, a meteorologist at the Meteorological Centre in Shimla, says, ‚ÄúThe pre-monsoon rainfall will‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/4NKYFQgi6R

‚Äî Press Trust of India (@PTI_News) June 17, 2025

   
11:59 (IST) 17 Jun 2025
India Weather Forecast Today LIVE Updates: IMD predicts extremely heavy rainfall in Saurashtra, Kutch today

Extremely heavy rainfall is likely at isolated places over Saurashtra and Kutch on Tuesday, the IMD forecast stated.

Isolated heavy to very heavy rainfall is also likely over other parts of Gujarat region this week, as per the forecast.

   
ADVERTISEMENT
11:08 (IST) 17 Jun 2025
India Weather Forecast Today LIVE Updates: IMD issues 'yellow' alert for Delhi; light rains with thunderstorms likely today

The weather department has issued a ‚Äòyellow‚Äô alert, forecasting light to moderate rainfall in Delhi, as the minimum temperature in the city on Tuesday settled at 29 degrees Celsius.

The weather conditions will be accompanied by thunderstorms, lightning, and gusty winds reaching speeds of up to 50-60 kmph.

The city‚Äôs air quality remained in the satisfactory category on Tuesday, with an Air Quality Index (AQI) of 96 at 9 am, Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) showed.

   
11:06 (IST) 17 Jun 2025
India Weather Forecast Today LIVE Updates: Heavy rainfall likely across parts of India today; IMD issues ‚Äòorange‚Äô alert for Karnataka

The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued an ‚Äòorange‚Äô alert for Karnataka on Tuesday, indicating heavy to very heavy rainfall, along with thunderstorms, lightning and gusty winds, with speed reaching 40-50 kmph, across the state.

Other parts of South India such as Tamil Nadu, Puducherry, Karaikal, Kerala, Mahe, Lakshadweep, coastal Andhar Pradesh, Yanam, Rayalaseema, and Telangana will also receive light to moderate rainfall today.

Strong surface winds are also very likely over Kerala & Mahe, Karnataka, Lakshadweep, coastal Andhar Pradesh, Yanam, and Telangana on Tuesday.

   
11:04 (IST) 17 Jun 2025
Good morning,

Welcome to our live blog. Please follow here for the latest weather updates from across India!

NewsCitiesChandigarhPre-monsoon showers bring relief to Punjab, ease stress on groundwater for paddy sowing
Pre-monsoon showers bring relief to Punjab, ease stress on groundwater for paddy sowing
The state received commutative rainfall of 24.7 mm, which is above the normal 22 mm for this time of the season, including 10.4 mm in just less than 24 hours. The pleasant rain helped reduce pressure on groundwater during the ongoing paddy sowing.
Written by Anju Agnihotri Chaba 

Jalandhar | Updated: June 18, 2025 10:12 IST
5 min read
‚ÄúThis rain couldn‚Äôt have come at a better time. The soil moisture will help with right stage of paddy transplantation and reduce reliance on tubewell irrigation, especially in central and southern Punjab,‚Äù said an agriculture officer. * ( Express Photo by Praveen Khanna

A spell of pre-monsoon rain on Tuesday brought major relief to Punjab after weeks of severe heat wave conditions.

The state received commutative rainfall of 24.7 mm, which is above the normal 22 mm for this time of the season, including 10.4 mm in just less than 24 hours. The pleasant rain helped reduce pressure on groundwater during the ongoing paddy sowing.

Of the 23 districts, 13 recorded normal or surplus rainfall mostly in the past 24 hours, according to data compiled by the Indian meteorological department from June 1 to June 17.

STORY CONTINUES BELOW THIS AD

This includes Amritsar, Barnala, Faridkot, Fatehgarh Sahib, Ludhiana, Moga, Muktsar, Patiala, Rupnagar, Sangrur, SBS Nagar, and others‚Äîwhere rainfall was adequate to moisten the soil, reducing the need for excessive irrigation or additional water for puddling before the paddy nursery transplantation.

‚ÄúThis rain couldn‚Äôt have come at a better time. The soil moisture will help with right stage of paddy transplantation and reduce reliance on tubewell irrigation, especially in central and southern Punjab,‚Äù said an agriculture officer.

Also Read | Ahead of monsoon onset in Delhi, PWD misses another deadline to desilt drains, 40% work pending

Districts like Barnala (71.3 mm), Ludhiana (65.1 mm), Rupnagar (59.9 mm), Moga (42.5 mm), Faridkot (36.6 mm), Patiala (35.1 mm), and SBS Nagar (38.2 mm), reported high rainfall between June 1 to June 17th. However, some areas including Tarn Taran (0.1 mm), Amritsar (0.4 mm), Kapurthala (4.9 mm), Jalandhar (7.9 mm) and Gurdaspur (8.3 mm) received little rain, and require high irrigation support.

Officials said this pre-monsoon rain is a positive sign amid Punjab‚Äôs groundwater crisis.

STORY CONTINUES BELOW THIS AD

With over 70% of the state‚Äôs irrigation dependent on underground water, especially for water-intensive crops like paddy, timely rain can make a significant difference in reducing power consumption for pumping and saving fast-depleting aquifers.

The agriculture department has also advised farmers to make the most of the natural moisture and plan their puddling and transplantation accordingly.

In Punjab, over 30 lakh hectares would come under the paddy crop and the sowing for the same was allowed from
June 1 this year against after June 10 which was the normal practice in Punjab since 2009 when the Punjab Sub soil Act was passed in the state to check the early sowing of paddy in the state.

While Punjab‚Äôs majority districts received a timely and widespread spell of pre-monsoon showers that offered critical relief, the neighboring state Haryana and joint capital Chandigarh which have experienced significantly lower rainfall.

STORY CONTINUES BELOW THIS AD

This disparity in precipitation has raised concerns for farmers in Haryana , another paddy growing state, which now face increased pressure on groundwater resources due to insufficient soil moisture ahead of the main sowing period.

In Haryana out of 22 districts 17 districts have received very less pre-monsoon rainfall.

According to data from the meteorological department, Chandigarh recorded only 18.4 mm of rainfall compared to a normal of 58.4 mm, marking a 69% deficit.

Similarly, Haryana as a whole saw a 31% shortfall in pre-monsoon rain, with some districts recording alarmingly low figures.

STORY CONTINUES BELOW THIS AD

For instance, Karnal received just 1.2 mm of rainfall against a normal of 31.8 mm‚Äîa staggering 96% deficit. Other major agricultural regions such as Fatehabad (-82%), Kaithal and Panchkula (-79%), Ambala (-71%), Faridabad (-70%), Panipat (-86%), Palwal & Kurukshetra (-75%) and also reported severe shortages.

Although a few districts like Nuh (30 mm, +146%) received above normal pre-monsoon rainfall, Mahendergarh (43.2 mm, +111%) and Hisar (37.6 mm, +107%), these were exceptions rather than the norm. The majority of Haryana‚Äôs districts have remained dry, resulting in inadequate natural soil moisture.

Meanwhile, the current rain deficit in several districts of Punjab and Haryana could pose significant challenges for farmers because at the time of sowing of Paddy nursery a lot of water is required for puddling and then a stagnant water upto 2-3 inches is maintained for several initial weeks in the crop and it consumes a huge water. ‚ÄúThis rain was the most awaited with paddy being a water-intensive crop, the lack of early-season rain means that farmers may have to rely heavily on groundwater for irrigation‚Äîfurther straining already stressed aquifers,‚Äù said Director Punjab Agriculture Department Jaswant Singh, adding that many such rain showers are required currently when paddy sowing is on.

According to IMD, as compared to yesterday today, there is a fall of -3.9¬∞C in average maximum temperature in Punjab, however, it is markedly below normal by -6¬∞C in the state.

STORY CONTINUES BELOW THIS AD

The highest maximum temperature in the state is 34.6¬∞C Recorded at Faridkot as far as Haryana is concerned, today there is a fall of -1.8¬∞C in average maximum temperature, however, it is markedly below normal by -7.4¬∞C in the state.

The highest maximum temperature in the state is 36.1¬∞C recorded at Faridabad. In Punjab gusty winds at a speed of 30 to 40 km/h are predicted at isolated places from 18th to 20th of June while heavy rainfall with gusty winds are predicted at isolated places from June 21-22.

Similarly, Ingush winds are predicted from June 18 to June 22, with heavy rainfall at isolated places from June 20 to June 22.
